elements: I need rest and nourishment, if I am to recover. But when my mouth waters, when my vision swims, I see the red cup; and now and then it will speak to me. [Dreaming with Hunger will also allow you to recover Health.]
This is my body. There are other bodies, but this one is mine, and my mind needs it as a fungus needs soil.
It's been said that blood and treasure are the cost of war. But blood istreasure. [Vitality can sometimes be used to gain Health.]
I need rest and nourishment, if I am to recover. But the Mother of Ants looks kindly on wounds. [Dreaming with an Injury will also allow you to recover Health.]
Disease has left me weak. I need rest and nourishment, if I am to recover.
'No live organism can continue for long to exist sanely under conditions of absolute reality.' - Shirley Jackson
I should seek knowledge as a fire seeks fuel, as a jackal seeks scraps. I never know what'll be useful. [Erudition can sometimes be used to gain Reason.]
I've seen too much. A nameless gnawing fear has its teeth in my hopes; an existential horror.
'Dull minds are never either intuitive or mathematical.' - Blaise Pascal
There are things I'll never understand, and those things will always be precious. [Glimmerings can sometimes be used to gain Passion.]
Light leaks through the cracks. My mind is brighter than it ever was..
This should be usable as if it were passion, although it is also a pollutant for hazard purposes
They remember who I am. [Mystique can be used to found a cult, and to recruit followers, but it doesn't last long.]
They remember what I've done. [Notoriety can be used to found a cult, and to recruit followers. It will fade over time, but more slowly than Mystique.]
A dead language: dead as diamonds. [Some books must be translated before they can be read.]

A people lived east of the lost lake Fucino. Horace warned that theirs was the land of witches. This was their language, called by some 'the dry tongue' and by others 'the tongue of witches'.[Some books must be translated before they can be read.]
It has occurred to me that I hold the key to power. [This can be used to end the game after completing a rite which confers unearthly power. Dreaming about it might change the goal.]
It has occurred to me that I hold the key to wisdom. [This can be used to end the game after completing a rite which gives unearthly knowledge. Dreaming about it might change the goal.]
With the correct rites, I can draw the powers of the Mansus into the waking world.
A moment in time. In another moment, it'll be gone.
